1: <sup>1</sup> Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
2: <sup>2</sup> Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
3: <sup>3</sup> Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
4: <sup>4</sup> For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
5: <sup>5</sup> This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
6: <sup>6</sup> I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
7: <sup>7</sup> Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
8: <sup>8</sup> Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
9: <sup>9</sup> There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
10: <sup>10</sup> I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
11: <sup>11</sup> But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
12: <sup>12</sup> So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
13: <sup>13</sup> Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
14: <sup>14</sup> I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
15: <sup>15</sup> The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.
16: <sup>16</sup> He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
